perturbation.original_text: Payments for Products delivered in accordance with the Purchase Orders, and any other to be made by the Company to Suppliers hereunder, shall be made in the Applicable Currency within [***]from the shipment of the applicable Products delivered.
perturbation.changed_text: Payments for Products delivered in accordance with the Purchase Orders, and any other to be made by the Company to Suppliers hereunder, shall be made in the Applicable Currency within 180 days from the shipment of the applicable Products delivered.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states that payments will be made within a certain timeframe from shipment of products delivered. By changing this timeframe to 180 days, the modification could create inconsistency with standard business practice and potentially violate the laws of the People's Republic of China which would likely have shorter legally mandated payment terms for goods and services. Such extended payment terms may also be deemed unfair or exploitative, particularly if the Suppliers are smaller entities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China
